list-item.label: a)
list-item.p: Exhaust systems which can be reached and touched during operation, access or maintenance shall be guarded in accordance with ISO 3457, considering touchable surface temperatures defined in ISO 13732-1.

list-item.label: b)
list-item.p: The engine exhaust system shall release the exhaust gas away from the operator and from the air inlet of the operator cab and away from other personnel stations on the machine.

list-item.label: c)
list-item.p: In addition, exhaust pipes shall be so directed that the risk for personnel in the close proximity during operation is avoided.

list-item.label: d)
list-item.p: A means to release the engine cooling system pressure shall be provided that addresses the risk of human exposure to hot water/steam.

list-item.label: e)
list-item.p: Underground rig diesel engines shall be designed to use a fuel which has a flash point exceeding 55 °C.

list-item.label: f)
list-item.p: Underground rig exhaust shall not be discharged upwards or downwards. Exhaust pipes directed upwards shall have an outlet that redirects exhaust.

list-item.label: g)
list-item.p: For electric start systems, an auxiliary starting aid electrical connector shall be provided that complies with ISO 11862.
